column3: I think you have a good chance for a long and healthy life
column4: but we still don’t know if it’s Dexter or Harrison. You know I think it’s Dexter.” The Director looked at his watch again: 8:29—ninety-seven minutes left.|Shall We Tell the President?|Jeffrey Archer

column1: 08:29|Mr. Trent himself followed a rigid routine. Each day
column5: arriving at 8:29.|The Great Train Robbery|Michael Crichton

column1: 08:29|At 8.29 I punched the front doorbell in Elgin Crescent. It was opened by a small oriental woman in a white apron. She showed me into a large
column2: empty sitting room with an open fire and a couple of huge oil paintings.|Engleby|Sebastian Faulks
